titles.title: Vocational Rehabilitation Services Reimbursement Act of 1987

A bill to amend titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act to ensure proper payments for reimbursement for reasonable and necessary costs of vocational rehabilitation services under State vocational rehabilitation plans.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 11/18/1987--Introduced. Vocational Rehabilitation Services Reimbursement Act of 1987 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to require payments for reimbursement of costs for rehabilitation services under the OASDI program to be made for each fiscal year in advance, in the amount of the reasonable and necessary costs of vocational rehabilitation services furnished during the preceding fiscal year ending September 30 of the preceding calendar year, increased or decreased by underpayments or overpayments in the preceding fiscal year. Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to require that payments for rehabilitation services for blind and disabled individuals under SSI be made in the same manner and under the same requirements as OASDI payments.
